messages.content: ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt is a custom node for ComfyUI that allows saving a png or jpeg image, with options to save the prompt/workflow in a text or json file for each image. It also supports workflow loading.
What are the known issues with ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt?
Currently, there are no known issues with ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt, but users are encouraged to open a complaint on GitHub if they have suggestions or complaints.
In which category is the ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt node added?
The ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt node is added to the IO category in ComfyUI.
To install ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt, use the command 'git clone https://github.com/mpiquero7164/ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt.git' in your ComfyUI custom nodes directory, then restart ComfyUI.
What are the built-in text tokens supported by ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt?
ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt supports the following built-in text tokens: [time], [time(format_code)], [hostname], and [user].
What does the '%a' directive represent in the datetime formatting?
The '%a' directive represents the weekday as the locale's abbreviated name, such as 'Sun', 'Mon', etc. in en_US locale.
What is the difference between '%Y' and '%y' directives in datetime formatting?

The '%Y' directive represents the year with century as a decimal number (e.g., 0001, 2014, 9998), while the '%y' directive represents the year without century as a zero-padded decimal number (e.g., 00, 01, 99).
